astrologie astrologie astrologie knowledge naturall order disposition god hath set starres planet iudge office propertie vertue bring end vse caluine astrologer knoweth course motion heauens teacheth vertue passe bondes become astrologer astronomer taketh vpon giue iudgement censure motion course heauens prognosticate destinie vnto creature earth man beast shall temperature aire condition earth state successe fruite bringeth foorth knowledge forespeake pestilence discases séeth death great men come commotion warres shall followe betwéene prince world thus saie knowe course heauens whereas sée coniunctions manie planet figure fatall disposition qualitie concurre reason whose influence inferiour partes calamity must happen heere abuse onelie name god naturall discourse reason hath comprehended motion course heauens also heauen selfe attribute vnto heauens thing onelie apperteineth god saie health man sickenesse man plentie earth scarcitie regument common life death gouernours thereof knowledge practise thing nothing almightie god hath made heauens end purpose man shold learne good fortune ill plaine gen 1 second daie god made firmament superiour starres text calleth rakiah end seperate water vnder firmament aboue firmament god called firmament heauen fourth daye god made sunne moone star • e sheweth purpose ende made one haue dominion daie night god put firmament heauen giue light vnto earth rule daie night put difference betwéene light darknesse diuide yeare porte spring sommer autume winter signes likewise saith text husbandman tilleth soweth ground obserueth without superstition sowe reape corne hée casteth ground winter receiueth againe summer doth marriner make reuolution moone decrease increase whereby knoweth tide ebbes flowe latter phisitions auicene auerrois hath likewise assigned vse man bodie therefore appoint diuersitie day practise phisicke one bée apt letting bloude purge bane maie obserued without superstition maie suffered notwithstanding obserue latter rule may minister receiue medicine heauens made serue v master v created man man therefore false superstition saie good bad plentie scarcitie sicknesse health warre peace dependeth influence heauens c whooper authority abuse astrologie thy wise men maie tell théeesa 19 12 maie knowe lord hoasts hath determined aegipt yet part astrologie prophet doth speake despite meddle saieng office knowe thing come passe make profession caluine thou art warned multitude thy counsellsesa 47 13 let astrologer stargasers pronosticatours stand vp saue thee thing shall come vpon thée beholde learne starre mutation fall kingdomes punish pride haue thrust themselues enterprise c caluine saith lord learne waie heathen afraide signes heaueniere 10 2 • though heathen bée afraide ¶god forbiddeth people giue credite feare constellation coiunctions starres planet haue power themselues gouerned secrete motion influence knowne man therefore certeine iudgement thereof deut 18 9 geneua adulterer abuseth woman bodie hir man doth sinne yet woman vndefiled hir minde chast vnspotted lucretia romane matrone liueth chast euer whose bodie though proude tarquinius sonne pleasure yet hir minde continued still chast faithfull hir husbande therefore shée consenting heart sinne fame recorded bée ornament womanhood perfect chastitie therefore saith saint hierom verie well corpus mulieris nothing done chast body diuelish lust doth suffer minde defiled anie filthinesse consent doth defend owne flesh offence whatsoeuer either lust patient hath either consented vnto suffered shalbe fault onelie doer violence shall imputed filthines corruption wound suffering soundnesse chastitie force minde minde vndefiled chastitie cannot defiled bodie whose member might haue bene disseuered one another another place magi timeamus c let v feare least inward vnderstanding corrupt chastitie faith doth therewith perish rather least woman violentlie defiled flesh chastitie defiled violence kept chavnce nothing commeth hap chaunce prouidence god nature immutable certaintie thereof whereby thing ruled excludeth chaunces hap fortune call chance hap fortune whatsoeuer appeareth betideth vnlooked vnforeséene aduentures without anie sure cause reason appeareth done foresight neither god neither man without number doth befal among men world therfore looke much doth yéeld vnto chaunce fortune much hée doth pul awaie prouidence god unto good christian men cléere case y• ther chaunceth nothing throughout whole world hazard aduentures prouidence god disposeth wherfore iudgement sayth musculus folowed whole psalter expressing word chaunter notwithstanding diuerse author doe diuerslie interpret saie signifieth victor ouercommer victorie maie thus agrée concord together thou take psalme bée christ dranke draw grose vnderstanding word drinking testifie vnto naturall flesh indéed memorial representation bodie bloud frith christ bare himselfe owne hand augustine hath saieng sacrament christ borne owne hand doth expound himselfe another placebare himselfe saieng ferebatur tanquam manibus borne certeine manner owne hand y• saith certaine manner may soone perceiue meaneth howbeit austen art hot within thou art cold • e inwardlie thou abhorrest ye word god yet dost thou outwardlie condemne wold thou wert either cold hot either christian none either perfect louer veritie el ful hater 1 • keepe commaundements ¶remember god commaundeth v anie thing doth therefore selues doe commaundeth lawe might sée know horrible damnacion captiuitie vnder sinne therefore repent come christ receiue néed god giue commaundements knoweth wel impossible v impossible right damneth v thing impossible v doe aunswere great presumption enquire cause maker murmure holie ordinaunce maie chaunged giue v commandements impossible v owne naturall strength keepe doth thereby might knowe weaknes séeke call helpeaugustin austen declareth well word saieng man doe perceiue commaundements anie thing impossible el hard let remaine himselfe let runne vnto god helper hath giuen commaundements intent desire might stirred vp might giue helpe c ¶héere sée austen saith commandements impossible strength gedeon 70 sonnes hée one named abimelech natus de concubina whose name iosephus saith droma abimelech father dead laboured helpe kinred mother side made king end might atteine vnto crowne slew 69 owne naturall brother nowe marke gedeon iust godlie man high god fauour therefore would againe hauing manie wiues owne néeded haue kept droma called concubine priuie whoore therefore must taken concubina taken malem partem harlot whoore euerie woman serua aut ancilla libero homine ducta vxorem concubina dicitur ye shall vnderstande olde time bond men bond woman counted vile neither taken vsed men wherefore absteined king meate daniel purposed heart bée polluted portion king meate drinke ¶héere doe doubt whether anie matter meate drinke daniel ought absteine seemeth note superstition knowe thinges pure vnto pure rule true worldes againe doe reade thing ioseph verie like daniel afterward vse meates hée great authoritie king wherfore alwaies obserued daniel therefore maie séeme either vnaduised zeale much singularitie maie aunswered god alloweth daniel fellowes myracle preseruing faire liking mourning straite diet therefore doubted god spirit wer thus ye first moued absteine time lawe giuen vnto god vnto bound lawe euerie seauenth yeare thou shalt kéepe frée yeare iubelie yeare shall kept manner ought shall bée owing anie man either friend neighbour brother maie aske againe lord frée yeare lord iubelie yeare yeare also called sabbatum terrae moses saieng vnto people wise sex annos agrum tuum c sixe yeares thou shalt sow thy land sixe yeares thou shalt cut thy vineyard gather fruite thereof seauenth yeare shall sabboth rest vnto land lord sabboth shall bée crop ground shall bring foorth owne kinde without thy labour shalt thou reape crop shall grow owne kinde thou shalt gather whie shall rotte vpon vine grasse corne vpon grounde grasse corne thou shalt reape grape thou shalt gather hoc est non tibi solo ea coacernabis neque repones federum tibi cum alijs commune vnto saie seauenth yeare non licet tibi debita exigere debt pardoned god commaundement consideration iubelie yeare couetous rich man next yeare following would require debtes poore neighbour bound vpon writing made call deede obligatorie saith esaie dissolue colligationes impiae c cancell thy wicked obligation loose vndoe heauie burthen oppresse thy neighbour dispatch let goe frée able vnto abide still truth hath nothing god truth hath euill himselfe p viret offer diuels let offer offering vnto diuelsleui 17 7 ¶hée offereth vnto diuels y• offereth vnto anie thing vnto god doth offering anie manner god willeth goeth whoring diuels psal 73 27 must aunswere diuell reasoning v thou art sinner saith diuell therefore thou art dampned thou saist sinner therefore bée righteous saued naie saith diuell thou shalt damned saie flie vnto christ hath suffered sin therfore satan thou shalt nothing preuaile y• thou goest terrifie setting forth y• greatnes sinnes bring heauinesse distrust dispaire hatred contempt blaspheming god yea rather thou saist sinner thou giuest armour weapon thy selfe thine owne swoorde maie cut thy throate treade thée vnder féet christ dyed sinner moreouer thou thy selfe preachest vnto glorie god thou puttest mée minde god fatherlie loue towards wretched dampned sinner loued worldiohn 5 24 gaue onelie begotten sonne whosoeuer beléeueth might perish haue euerlasting life also oft thou doest obiect sinner oft thou callest remembraunce benefite christ redéemer vpon whose shoulder vpon mine lie sinnes lord hath laide iniquity vpon againesaie • 3 transgression people smitten wherfore thou obiectest sinner thou doest terifie comfort mée aboue measure luther vpon gal devotion true deuotion pure religion true deuotion called latine pieta hath annexed therewith diuine promise present life come witnesseth paule 1 tim 4 1 tim 4 nothing el obseruation christ lawe psalme purenesse thereof called siluer fined often manie time fire hath chaffe itpsal 12 6 hath men tradition pure cleane wheate sheweth ieremie writing thusiere 23 28 chaffe wheate therefore beholde come prophet saith lord steale word euerie one neighbour deceiue people lye féeding soules like receiue bread wine wée afraid eate drinke though wist whether poyson true wée must beware poison praie god preserue v men foolish sterue themselues forbeare eating drinking feare heart hemmyng god said haue eares god sayd haue eares heareth thingesaugustin sap 1 10 eare iealous heareth thing noise grudgings shall hid earth founded vpon sea propertie wise menmat 7 27 maie plainlie appeare wordes sauiour gospell saint mathewe shall goe builde anie stronge house bée sure foundation shall bée laide vpon sande muddie myre vppon rocke sure stedfast grounde knowing otherwise labour cost commeth shortlie naught whilest either violence winde waues hudge floude doe rush house breake downe séeing right propertie substantial wise politike builder wonderfutl paradoxe inopinable sentence saye qui ipse fundauit c lorde himselfe fountaine hath founded whole earth hudge heauie thing vppon wauering water flowing floudes bée wordes prophet super maria fundauit eam super flumina preperauit eam saint hierome readeth super flumina stabiliuit eam upon sea hath founded whole earth vpon floudes hath stablished sentence cannot séeme iudgement men meruailous straunge wonderfull saieng earth founded vpon water naturall reason lead man say god hath founded sea vppon earth earth vpon water nam terra aqua stabilimentum est non aqua terrae foure element fire aire water earth orbe fire highest couereth earth round aire likewise ought natural cōsent couer ye water round water earth wherefore followeth good reason earth beeing heauiest lowest foure element next vnder water ought therefore called foundation water water doe lie vpon earth water foundation earth reason strong naturall wit able impugne againe 104 psalme prophet saith lorde hath founded earth vpon owne weight stablenesse fundasti terram super stabilitatem tuam non inclinabitur seculum seculi ouid poet saith like manner tellus pōderatū librata suis earth staied paised meanes owne weight saith earth founded yet prophet saith dominus super maria fundauit orbem terrae super flumina stabiliuit eam lord hath founded whole earth vpon sea vppon floudes hée stablished yée shall vnderstand therefore order naturall reason earth like lowest foure element next vnder water ought altogether couered water vnderneath water ye almightie mightie creatour thing myraculous diuine power hath altered order generall hath made lawe statute peculiar water shall ouerflow whole earth contented portion earth dwell vpon get corner wise hardie head passe bound limit appointed statute made vppon third daie creation world reade gen 1 chapter wise congregantur aqua sub coelo sunt locum vnum appareat arida let water vnder heauen gathered together one place drie lande maie appeare peculiar commaundement god philosopher béeing ignoraunt séeing miraculous worke aboue nature called natura particularis ye must note forasmuch peculiar order god hath established betweene water drie lande earth exalted aboue water euen farre walles house aboue foundation consideration miraculous worke god earth héere said ye prophet builded partlie vpon salt sea partlie vpon fresh floudes earth wonderfullie exalted euerie place aboue water euen far wall house aboue foundation water absolutelie foundation piller earth ric turnar earthqvake earthquake doe come earthquake shaking earth caused meanes winde exhalation inclosed within caues earth finde passage breake foorth el narrow waie cannot soone enough deliuered wherefore great force violence breaketh foorth one shaketh earth another rendeth cleaueth sometime • 24 déeds man iustified faith onelie ¶ye sée ye man iustified c declared iust openlie knowne righteous like fruites good tree knowne good otherwise maie sentence interpreted could nothing foolish confesse doe beléeue vaine godly may without scrupulositie conscience present sacrifice gentils sit feast bankets kéepe honor idol minde restored vnto selfe doe honor worship true lyuing god alone therfore contēueth idol cannot sith purified saith polluted defiled thing y• offered vnto thē unto paule maketh answere although thou doest beléeue one god doest therfore vnderstand idol worshipping sacrices offered vnto méere vanitie yet men much neither come sacrifice ye conscience weake hath yet put away olde inueterate error sucked forefather doth conscience sit meates according olde superstition hath full shaken doth feare dread god specially séeth thée taketh sound iudgment sit prophane meates doth suspect thou doest eate none conscience hee doth smally offended thy bolde example saint ambrose theophilactus also erasmus allowe exposition ye apply image yée shall finde nothing doth strongly impugne although strong faith knoweth image bée nothing yet another hath weaker faith iudge long shall sée thus stand church reason thus himselfe idolatrie damnable y• preacher doe say sith kept church tollerable borne withall learned men cradell haue bene nouseled superstition haue bene perswaded holinesse image kept still errour canne neuer come perfect pure faith therefore wise point put downe image sith reason thing naught shoulde stand house god place praier thereby destruction vndoing sir cheeke idolatrous thing may conuerted honour god temple idolls groues lyke thing authoritie ouerthrowen although manifest doe honour detest yet maye therefore couet vse priuate v onely commoditie may appeare destroie religion sake couetousnesse conuerted priuate owne vse common v honour true god done brought passe done brought passe men themselues idolater wicked person ought done ought done go • th man lawe lawe fulfilled outward workes onely though heart neuer farre god iudgeth ground heart yea thought secret moouings minde therefore law requireth grounde heart loue bottome thereof content outward workes onely rebuketh workes spring loue lowe bottome heart though appeare outward neuer honest good christ rebuketh pharisies aboue open sinner calleth hypocrite say simulars painted sepulcher pharesies yet liued men pure pertaining outward deedes workes lawe yea paule third chapter epistle philippian confesseth himselfe touching law one man could complaine notwithstanding yet murtherer christen persecuted formented sore compelled blaspheme christ altogether mercilesse many nowfaine outward good workes tindale ¶we vnderstand lawe commaundements onely god gaue moses two table stone wherein comprehended rest doctrine god contained holy scripture good thing god alloweth requireth v bound doe euill displeaseth ought followe beside sheweth v offence sinnes stand debters vnto iudgment god preacheth vnto v nothing el wrath cursse haue deserued offending ye law condemned god transgressor commaundements thereby declared worthy death eternall damnation law serueth rather condemne saue v yet fault law good holy iust fault v wicked nature doe accomplish law law doth vtter sinnes sheweth v plainly disease daungerous phisitions doth cannot heale v sendeth v another able heale disease none one christ iesus lord law deuided two part first table1 table pertaineth god thou shalt haue none god thou shalt make thée image likenes c thou shalt take name god vaine c remember sanctifie sabboth day c table pertaineth neighbour honor thy father thy mother c kil commit none adulterie steale beare false witnes thy neighbor couet thy neighbor house wife c doctrine comprised two tables2 table christ reduced ij point loue god aboue al thing thy neighbor thy selfe ye law prophet depend vpon ij commaundements whatsoeuer ye wold men vnto ye vnto p viret platoes definition lawe plato plato booke lawes publike wealth minos séemeth thus define lawe namely vpright manner gouerning conuenient meanes directeth vnto best ende setting foorth paine vnto transgressours rewardes vnto obedient definition maye bée aptlye applyed vnto lawe god yet law vnlesse god pet mar vpon rom fol 137 office vse law vse ende lawe isvse lawe accuse condempne v guiltie liue securitie may sée themselues daunger sin wrath death eternall may terrified brought euen brinke desperation trembling quaking falling leafe vnder lawe law requireth perfect obedience vnto god condemneth doe accomplish certaine man liuing able perfourme obedience notwithstanding god straightly requireth v law therefore iustifieth condemneth according saieng cursed abideth thing written lawe therefore teacheth lawe minister lawe c luth vpon gal fol 69 lawe nature law nature islawe nature light iudgement reason whereby doe discerne betwixt good euill thomas aquinus saith law nature nothing el perticipation eternall law reasonable creature definition indeede doth expresse vnto v iudgement light reason commeth vnto v say eternal law declareth parte reasonable creature maye comprise also angells whose nature heere nothing question doe define lawe largely sort lawe nature common sentence iudgement wherevnto men together assent furder god graued euery man minde appointed frame men definition lye sayde lye receiue speaketh false lye nothing else speake minde lyers speake otherwise haue heart desire deceiue vtterly iustice amitie mutually owe one thrée thing therfore lye first speake false secondly speaking thirdly desire deceiue first part longeth matter two partes perteine vnto forme pet mar vpon iudic fol 87 ¶octauian emperour demanded vpon time question pisto philosopherpisto philosopher tell pisto shall men doe brought extremitie speake truth condemneth himselfe make lye saueth vertuous man saith ought rather choose ouercome truth ouercome lye vnpossible man lyar shoulde continue longe prosperitie whether may lye preserue lyfe neighbour murtherer shoulde persecute man kill thou knowest lyeth kidden thou presentlye art demaunde thée thou knowest whether aunswereth thou valiant courage becommeth christian thou must saye knowe vtter doe ye ye matter commeth point safetie man life thou must make lye know thou thou oughtest commit thing vnto god thou hast nothing therein doe either thou must answere thou wilt betray el thou must hold thy peace thy silence murtherer suspect thy house thou shalt séeme giue occasion taking verie déede thou hast done thou canst let thinke wherefore matter rather committed vnto god thou shouldest make lie howbeit thou must verie well weigh thy selfe namely speake thou say al yet speake falsely case thinke gréeke called nouollone signifieth sufferance patience cicero booke de inuencione maketh difference betwéene perseueraunce patience defineth perseuerance stedfast continuall abiding matter well considered weighed patience willing long sufferaunce harde painefull thinges honesty sake profite perseueraunts generall vertue whereby doe constantly abide procéede wée haue begunne vppon good reason patience kinde perseueraunce wée doe willingly constantly suffer thinges harde painefull sorrowfull losse doe mislike definition cicero euerye suffering aduersitie ought straight bée called patience man worlde suffereth many thinges would doe hée could anye wise withstande yet doe call patience lyke doe call impatient neither doe suffer aduersitie doe susteine euill discontented minde therefore lyke vnto patience requisite willinge sufferaunce vnpatiencie doe vnwillinglye striuing anger suffer doe suffer vpon good consideration put definitiō patience onely willing long sufferaunce also euils vertue patience consisteth onely sufferaunce bée willing requisite also constancye suffering shall finde manye willing suffer bée soone gone become impatient vnto cannot attributed true patience sorte must bée willing continuall lyke fayth doe beléeue time shrinke away time temptation true fayth loue true doe loue daye hate morowe true patience neither thou patient season within chaunge thy patience impatiencie truth vertues cannot stand without constancie musculus fo 522 ¶this worde patience patientnesse betokeneth men become blockish haue heauinesse combred anye griefe féele aduersitie thée especially peter name thy faith shoulde faile thou wilt fall fowler rest knowe god hath heard prayer although thou wilt denye thy mouth yet thou wilt denye thy heart thou wilt sinne sinne shall loued christ knowledge himselfe sonne christ iesus maye bée assured theyr adoption iustification fayth working charitie maketh workes shine men glorie father made conforme image god maye finally receiue glorye prepared vessells mercye latter partes wit vocation iustification fayth effect haue added thinke wée imagine sufficient bée predestinate howe wickedlye soeuer wée liue constantly affirme playne contrarye wit none liuing wickedly canne haue assuraunce predestinate lyfe euerlasting yea though man angell woulde beare recorde yet owne conscience condempne vnto time vnfeinedly rather purchase halter remission sinnes another repentance followeth instification remission sin florishing fruit faith faith wee perceiue ye fauour kindnesse y• louing father hath shewed v sonne iesus christ hath reconciled v vnto himselfe bloud sonne begin loue hate body sinne lament sory member fraile cannot fulfill ye lawe god mourning bewailing infirmitie causeth v abstaine meate drinke worldly pleasure pure fasting talke vnderstand repentaunce commeth purge sinnes committed onely • taketh occasion sinnes committed know poyson remaineth flesh seeketh meanes make v hate body sinne subdue manner workes god hath appointed intent time come displease god mercifull father gentlenesse often pardoneth forgiueth v touched manner repentaunce finde scripture helpeth sinne rastall dreameth wote expresse vttermost meane repentaunce marke exampleexample house man builde house doth cost much labour money haue layed sure foundation tempest commeth house doeth fall sorie repent hath foolishly bestowed money labour notwithstanding great sorrow repentaunce cannot set vp house againe fallen onely taketh occasion ruine house teach owner wit another time y• buildeth againe may make sure foundation euen though thou repent neuer much cannot get remission thy sinnes must pardoned onely ye faith christ bloud neuerthelesse doth teach thée wit learne thée tame thy body subdue cast low foundation time thou maist better resist assault diuell world flesh doth frith teach repentance let world take christ shéepe doe heare voice frith fol 74 reprobation definition word reprobation reprobation wise purpose god whereby hée hath eternitie constantly decréed without iniustice haue mercie hath loued hath ouerhipped iust condemnation might declare wrath towards sinner also glory pet wherefore sticke vnto wil leane trumpery ware counterfaite satisfaction pope priest frier musculus fol 219 two manner satisfaction two manner satisfaction one god neighbour god cannot world make satisfaction one sinne insomuch euery grasse ground man holy euer paule peter shuld pray vnto god life long one crime yet could make satisfaction onely bloude christ hath made full satisfaction vnto god crime heb 7 el none remedie wee perish another satisfaction neighbour haue offended bound pacifie agrée lawe realme determineth betweene v defamed bounde pacifie restore good name againe haue aunswere rather content haue thy ware vnsolde loose thy money thy saluation christ reason faithfully conscience let thy soule deare vnto thee thy corruptible substaunce though thou loose part thy substance yet maist thou liue thou loose god thou canst liue greater reward shalt thou haue loosing feare god thou hadst giuen almes done paine loue lord requireth worthy crowne done without paine moreouer counsell thée friend saith chrisostome thou true christian thou neuer compell man sweare whether sweareth right wrong thou art without daunger afore god considering christ whose seruaunt thou oughtest hath giuen thee sore commaundement contrary beside though oth true yet thy conscience cléere periury much matter doubtfull vnto thée thou puttest daunger thereof false hast thou enforced temptation temptation nothing else take proofe triall thing wherefore end temptation rightly called knowledge passe ouer water doe trie shallowe place know depth water wound also tried surgions féele déepenesse tempting therefore knowledge sought god néedeth new fresh knowledge nature knoweth thing perfectly tempteth onely doth leade men knowledge thing ought knowe wherefore sometime tempteth good holymen hée bringeth lyght maketh open fayth obedience • strength godlynesse laye hidde heartes sée thing might glorifie god authour tempted haue gotten victorye may giue thankes desire euen hath done woulde vouchsafe helpe continually temptation pet mar vpon iudic fol 33 temptation generally euill temptation tryall euill god tempted seruauntes one friende tempted childe tried father wife husband
